glsa.title: VLC: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in VLC might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.

description.p: A buffer overflow was discovered in the DecodeAdpcmImaQT function in modules/codec/adpcm.c in the VideoLAN VLC media player.

impact.p: Remote attackers, by enticing a user to execute a specially crafted QuickTime IMA file, could cause a Denial of Service condition or possibly execute arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All VLC users should upgrade to the latest version:
